verses.kjv: And when Abram was ninety years old and nine, the LORD appeared to Abram, and said unto him, I am the Almighty God; walk before me, and be thou perfect.
verses.ct: When Abram was 99 years old, the LORD appeared to him and said, "I am the Almighty God. Live your life in my presence and be blameless."

verses.kjv: And I will make my covenant between me and thee, and will multiply thee exceedingly.
verses.ct: "I will establish my covenant between me and you, and I will increase your numbers tremendously."

verses.kjv: And Abram fell on his face: and God talked with him, saying,
verses.ct: Abram dropped to the ground with his face down, and God spoke to him:

verses.kjv: As for me, behold, my covenant is with thee, and thou shalt be a father of many nations.
verses.ct: "As for me, pay attention — my covenant is with you, and you will become the father of many nations."

verses.kjv: Neither shall thy name any more be called Abram, but thy name shall be Abraham; for a father of many nations have I made thee.
verses.ct: "Your name will no longer be Abram. Instead, your name will be Abraham, because I have made you the father of many nations."

verses.kjv: And I will make thee exceeding fruitful, and I will make nations of thee, and kings shall come out of thee.
verses.ct: "I will make you incredibly fruitful. Nations will come from you, and kings will descend from you."

verses.kjv: And I will establish my covenant between me and thee and thy seed after thee in their generations for an everlasting covenant, to be a God unto thee, and to thy seed after thee.
verses.ct: "I will establish my covenant between me and you and your descendants after you, through every generation, as a permanent covenant — to be God to you and to your descendants after you."

verses.kjv: And I will give unto thee, and to thy seed after thee, the land wherein thou art a stranger, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession; and I will be their God.
verses.ct: "I will give to you and your descendants after you the land where you are now living as a foreigner — the entire land of Canaan — as a permanent possession. And I will be their God."

verses.kjv: And God said unto Abraham, Thou shalt keep my covenant therefore, thou, and thy seed after thee in their generations.
verses.ct: Then God said to Abraham, "For your part, you must keep my covenant — you and your descendants after you, through every generation."

verses.kjv: This is my covenant, which ye shall keep, between me and you and thy seed after thee; Every man child among you shall be circumcised.
verses.ct: "Here is my covenant that you must keep between me and you and your descendants after you: every male among you must be circumcised."

verses.kjv: And ye shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin; and it shall be a token of the covenant betwixt me and you.
verses.ct: "You must circumcise the flesh of your foreskin, and this will serve as the sign of the covenant between me and you."

verses.kjv: And he that is eight days old shall be circumcised among you, every man child in your generations, he that is born in the house, or bought with money of any stranger, which is not of thy seed.
verses.ct: "Every male among you who is 8 days old must be circumcised, through every generation — whether born in your household or purchased with money from a foreigner who is not one of your descendants."

verses.kjv: He that is born in thy house, and he that is bought with thy money, must needs be circumcised: and my covenant shall be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.
verses.ct: "Those born in your household and those purchased with your money must all be circumcised. My covenant will be marked in your flesh as a permanent covenant."

verses.kjv: And the uncircumcised man child whose flesh of his foreskin is not circumcised, that soul shall be cut off from his people; he hath broken my covenant.
verses.ct: "Any uncircumcised male — one whose foreskin has not been circumcised — that person must be cut off from his people. He has violated my covenant."

verses.kjv: And God said unto Abraham, As for Sarai thy wife, thou shalt not call her name Sarai, but Sarah shall her name be.
verses.ct: God also said to Abraham, "As for your wife Sarai, you will no longer call her Sarai. From now on, her name will be Sarah."

verses.kjv: And I will bless her, and give thee a son also of her: yea, I will bless her, and she shall be a mother of nations; kings of people shall be of her.
verses.ct: "I will bless her and will also give you a son through her. I will bless her so that she becomes the mother of nations — kings of peoples will descend from her."

verses.kjv: Then Abraham fell upon his face, and laughed, and said in his heart, Shall a child be born unto him that is an hundred years old? and shall Sarah, that is ninety years old, bear?
verses.ct: Abraham dropped to the ground with his face down and laughed, thinking to himself, "Can a child really be born to a man who is 100 years old? Can Sarah actually give birth at 90?"

verses.kjv: And Abraham said unto God, O that Ishmael might live before thee!
verses.ct: Abraham said to God, "If only Ishmael could live under your blessing!"

verses.kjv: And God said, Sarah thy wife shall bear thee a son indeed; and thou shalt call his name Isaac: and I will establish my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant, and with his seed after him.
verses.ct: But God replied, "No — your wife Sarah will give birth to a son for you, and you will name him Isaac. I will establish my covenant with him as a permanent covenant for his descendants after him."

verses.kjv: And as for Ishmael, I have heard thee: Behold, I have blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly; twelve princes shall he beget, and I will make him a great nation.
verses.ct: "As for Ishmael, I have heard your request. Look, I have blessed him and will make him fruitful and will increase his numbers tremendously. He will become the father of 12 princes, and I will make him into a great nation."

verses.kjv: But my covenant will I establish with Isaac, which Sarah shall bear unto thee at this set time in the next year.
verses.ct: "But my covenant I will establish with Isaac, whom Sarah will give birth to for you at this same time next year."

verses.kjv: And he left off talking with him, and God went up from Abraham.
verses.ct: When God finished speaking with Abraham, he went up from Abraham's presence.

verses.kjv: And Abraham took Ishmael his son, and all that were born in his house, and all that were bought with his money, every male among the men of Abraham’s house; and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in the selfsame day, as God had said unto him.
verses.ct: That very same day, Abraham took his son Ishmael, along with every male in his household — both those born there and those purchased with his money — and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin, exactly as God had told him.

verses.kjv: And Abraham was ninety years old and nine, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
verses.ct: Abraham was 99 years old when he was circumcised.

verses.kjv: And Ishmael his son was thirteen years old, when he was circumcised in the flesh of his foreskin.
verses.ct: His son Ishmael was 13 years old when he was circumcised.

verses.kjv: In the selfsame day was Abraham circumcised, and Ishmael his son.
verses.ct: On that very same day, both Abraham and his son Ishmael were circumcised.

verses.kjv: And all the men of his house, born in the house, and bought with money of the stranger, were circumcised with him.
verses.ct: Every male in his household — those born there and those purchased with money from foreigners — was circumcised along with him.
